availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James W. C. Goodloe (Hopkins County, Ky, blacksmith )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Kentucky native. Son of John W. Goodloe and Wealthy A. Goodloe. Married to Mary Goodloe. Father of John D. Goodloe, James W. Goodloe, and Sallie Goodloe. Blacksmith in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Blacksmith in Hopkins County in 1860. Blacksmith in Hopkins County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 837.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 328B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, X County, KY, Month 186X, p. X.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Hopkins County Administrators Bonds, 1859-1877, p. 433.
